title.value: Discrete Probabilistic Inference as Control in Multi-path Environments
title.justification: The title is directly mentioned at the beginning of the document.
title.quote: Discrete Probabilistic Inference as Control in Multi-path Environments

extractions.description: The paper explores sampling from a discrete and structured distribution as a sequential decision problem. It proposes using Generative Flow Networks (GFlowNets) to sample objects proportionally to a predefined reward. The paper extends methods to correct the reward in MaxEnt RL to ensure unbiased sampling in scenarios where multiple paths lead to the same outcome. It also establishes equivalences between certain GFlowNet and MaxEnt RL objectives, and evaluates the performance of various algorithms on problems that involve sampling from discrete distributions.

type.justification: The paper is focused on proposing theoretical connections and equivalences between GFlowNets and MaxEnt RL.
type.quote: we show deeper connections between GFlowNets and MaxEnt RL algorithms.

name.justification: The paper is primarily focused on probabilistic inference using generative flow networks and reinforcement learning techniques.
name.quote: Approximate probabilistic inference has seen a tremendous amount of progress, notably from a variational perspective coupled with deep neural networks.

name.justification: The paper heavily discusses techniques from reinforcement learning and their application in generative flow networks.
name.quote: Unlike RL though, which seeks an optimal policy maximizing the cumulative reward, the objective of a GFlowNet is to find a policy such that objects can be sampled proportionally to their cumulative reward.

name.justification: The paper introduces Generative Flow Networks as a key concept in probabilistic modeling and sampling.
name.quote: Bengio et al. (2021) introduced a new class of probabilistic models called Generative Flow Networks (GFlowNets).

name.justification: The paper discusses GFlowNets as the primary model for sampling from discrete distributions.
name.quote: Generative Flow Networks (GFlowNets) learn a stochastic policy that samples objects proportionally to their reward.

is_contributed.justification: GFlowNets were not contributed in this paper but were explored further based on previous contributions.
is_contributed.quote: Bengio et al. (2021) introduced a new class of probabilistic models called Generative Flow Networks (GFlowNets).

is_executed.justification: The paper does not provide details about executing or running computational experiments directly involving GFlowNets, only theoretical explorations and previous empirical studies are discussed.
is_executed.quote: we explore...We also prove...Finally, we study empirically the performance of multiple MaxEnt RL and GFlowNet algorithms on multiple problems.

is_compared.justification: GFlowNets are compared to maximum entropy reinforcement learning algorithms.
is_compared.quote: Finally, we study empirically the performance of multiple MaxEnt RL and GFlowNet algorithms on multiple problems involving sampling from discrete distributions.

referenced_paper_title.value: Flow Network based Generative Models for Non-Iterative Diverse Candidate Generation
referenced_paper_title.justification: This work is associated with Bengio et al. (2021) introduction of GFlowNets.
referenced_paper_title.quote: Bengio et al. (2021) introduced a new class of probabilistic models called Generative Flow Networks (GFlowNets).
